turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Hi! How are you?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Good! Hows your day?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: so far so good thanks! I'd like to talk to you about an NGO I know if that's alright with you?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: yeah sure! What NGO?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Have you heard of Save the Children? I know a lot of organizations do amazing work overseas - they are one that focuses specifically on helping ensure children have rights to education, health, and safety

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I have never heard of them actually, but thats awesome! Education, health and safety are key points that I think are very important to the less fortunate children overseas.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: I agree - certainly important for everyone, but often its the kids who can\'t speak for themselves that have the hardest time accessing the things they need. Between working with immediate disaster relief (like post hurricane Harvey) or longer term issues - like improving access to clean water in Cambodia, and they are on the "Wise Giving" award from Better Business Bureau - which measures how well funds get to the charitable work (versus expensive staff, etc)

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Wow. I actaully never knew that the BBB had such a thing to measure that sort of implication. I do know in fact that many NGO's out there do not use the money for the actual mission they are seeking.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: I think that's why BBB set it up - it's an accreditation for charities to make sure people know how funds are being spent. Have you ever donated to a charity doing work like this?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I have donated to The Hunger Project, in which they seek to mobilize permanent programs to end world hunger. Missions are mostly in rural areas of Africa, Latin America and Asia. What about you?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: I have with Save the Children and Habitat for Humanity. I even went on a trip with Habitat to Malawi which was amazing. The researchers of this study have given participants the ability to donate a portion of the payment to Save the Children. Would you be willing to donate? 77 cents shelters a refugee for a day

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Of course! I will donate $1.54! Thank you for telling me that.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: you're welcome - thank you for your donation - I really appreciate it!

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Your very welcome! I am happy to donate to a good cause.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: I understand that this chat is complete once I\'ve shared details, and you\'ve either committed to donate, or decided to decline today. I also understand a "10 minimum chat turns" which I think we have hit. Is there anything you think we need to do before hitting "return"?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I am at 7 chat turns unfortunately.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: that's okay - I am glad I asked because I thought they meant 10 total, but you're right - it might be 10 EACH

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: So how do I donate the $1.54 to that certain charity? Does it give me an option once we're done here?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: the research team collects the donations and sends it.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Okay awesome.
